isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (355.6 MM) STAMPED ANGLE-SPRING CLUTCH - ADJUSTMENT INSTRUCTIONS

svcsubsecinfo.para: Before making any adjustments, review the following precautions required to assure optimum clutch performance:

note.para: Internal adjustment of the adjusting ring must be made before any linkage adjustment is made.

step1.para: All internal clutch adjustments should be made with the clutch pedal down (clutch released).
Turning the adjusting ring clockwise moves the release bearing toward the transmission. Turning the adjusting ring counterclockwise moves the release bearing toward the engine.
Linkage adjustment should only be performed in the following case:
To compensate for linkage wear, clutch brake wear or transmission bearing cap wear; or replacement of relative clutch or linkage components.

Release Travel is the total distance the release bearing moves during a full pedal stroke. Release Travel of 1/2" to 9/16" is required to assure that the release bearing releases far enough to allow the driven discs to spin freely, avoiding clutch drag.

Free Pedal, or the amount of play in the clutch pedal in the cab, is an indication of clutch adjustment. Free Pedal of approximately 1 1/2" to 2" is optimum. Adjustment procedures should begin before no Free Pedal exists.

Free Travel is the clearance distance between the release yoke fingers and the clutch release bearing wear pads. This dimension regulates the amount of Free Pedal. The optimum amount of Free Travel is 1/8".
Clutch Brake Squeeze begins at that point at which the clutch brake is initially engaged. Optimum Clutch Brake Squeeze should begin at 1/2" to 1" from the end of pedal stroke or floor board.
